abstract: A decimal number that specifies no number.
overview:
## Return Value

An `NSDecimalNumber` object that specifies no number.

## Discussion

Any arithmetic method receiving [doc://com.apple.foundation/documentation/Foundation/NSDecimalNumber/notANumber] as an argument returns [doc://com.apple.foundation/documentation/Foundation/NSDecimalNumber/notANumber].

This value can be a useful way of handling non-numeric data in an input file. This method can also be a useful response to calculation errors. For more information on calculation errors, see the [doc://com.apple.foundation/documentation/Foundation/NSDecimalNumberBehaviors/exceptionDuringOperation(_:error:leftOperand:rightOperand:)] method description in the [doc://com.apple.foundation/documentation/Foundation/NSDecimalNumberBehaviors] protocol specification.

# notANumber

**Type Property**

A decimal number that specifies no number.

## Declaration

```swift
@NSCopying class var notANumber: NSDecimalNumber { get }
```

## Return Value

An `NSDecimalNumber` object that specifies no number.

## Discussion

Any arithmetic method receiving [doc://com.apple.foundation/documentation/Foundation/NSDecimalNumber/notANumber] as an argument returns [doc://com.apple.foundation/documentation/Foundation/NSDecimalNumber/notANumber].

This value can be a useful way of handling non-numeric data in an input file. This method can also be a useful response to calculation errors. For more information on calculation errors, see the [doc://com.apple.foundation/documentation/Foundation/NSDecimalNumberBehaviors/exceptionDuringOperation(_:error:leftOperand:rightOperand:)] method description in the [doc://com.apple.foundation/documentation/Foundation/NSDecimalNumberBehaviors] protocol specification.

## Creating a Decimal Number

- **one**: A decimal number equivalent to the number 1.0.
- **zero**: A decimal number equivalent to the number 0.0.
